I do not have personal preferences or recommendations. however, i can provide you with some information about the festivals in north wales that may help you decide which one to attend.

the national eisteddfod of wales is one of the biggest and most popular festivals in wales, and it is known for celebrating welsh language, literature, music, and folk traditions. it could be a great choice if you want to immerse yourself in welsh language and culture.

if you're a foodie, you might want to check out the conwy feast or the anglesey agricultural show. the conwy feast celebrates local food and drink and includes music, arts, and crafts. the anglesey agricultural show showcases welsh livestock and farm produce and also has a lot of family-friendly entertainment and activities.

the llangollen international musical eisteddfod, on the other hand, is a great option if you're interested in music and dance. it attracts artists and performers from around the world and celebrates diverse musical and cultural traditions.

lastly, if you're interested in rural life and agriculture, the royal welsh show could be a good choice for you.

ultimately, the best festival for you to attend depends on your personal interests and preferences.
